results.title: Good Will Hunting
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Lawrence Bender and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)

results.title: Going my way
results.brief_description: This is the nostalgic and heartwarming story of young Father O’Malley (Bing Crosby), sent by his Bishop to help Father Fitzgibbon (Barry Fitzgerald) at the mortgage-ridden St Dominic’s parish. Initially, the younger priest’s unconventional methods antagonise his gruff superior, but eventually Father O’Malley wins over the elderly priest, organises a gang of unruly kids into a choir, and rescues the parish from debt. Bing Crosby sings the famed songs: “Too-Ra-Loo-Ra-Loo-Ra” and “Swinging on a star”. This outstanding film won 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Bing Crosby) and Best Supporting Actor (Barry Fitzgerald).

results.title: Gidget
results.creator_credit: Paul Wendkos, Lewis Rachmil and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A classic teenage film filled with sun, surf and romance. Sandra Dee became the stereotypical blonde haired blue-eyed surfer girl in this first Gidget movie. Francie Lawrence desperately wants to find true love at 16, and becomes a mascot for a group of college-bound surfer boys and their drop-out leader the Great Kahoona, played by Cliff Robertson. During the summer vacation she becomes attracted to Moondoggie played by James Darren. Gidget does everything to make him fall for her and by the end of the summer her dreams come true.

results.title: Giantland
results.creator_credit: Burt Gillett, Walt Disney and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Mickey tells a crowd of orphans a version of “Jack and the Beanstalk” in which he plays the leading role and takes on Rumplewatt, the “king of the giants - prince of the tyrants.”

results.title: Gertrud
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Adapted from a long-forgotten play by Hjalmar Soderberg written during the early years of the 20th century, Dreyer’s controversial last film centres on a proud, stubborn woman who demands total commitment in love and forsakes both her husband and a former lover for a young musician who is relatively indifferent to her. The film moves at a slow, theatrical pace with long takes recorded mainly in direct sound (though shot principally in a studio), and deserves to be ranked along with ‘The Magnificent Ambersons, ‘Lola Montes’, and ‘The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance’ as one of the great haunted-memory films. Its meaning hinges partially on the refusal or inability to compromise and what this implies over the range of an entire life (in this case Dreyer’s as well as his heroine’s). The heroine may be regarded as a monster, a sublime and saintly martyr, or most likely an impossible fusion of the two. Dreyer’s film has a similarly dialectical and contradictory effect—at once narrative and (in the figure of Gertrud herself) nonnarrative, static and flowing, a tribute to free will and a positing of the unconscious as tragic destiny. Reference: Jonathan Rosenbaum. Chicago Online Reader.http://onfilm.chireader.com/MovieCaps/G/GE/03973_GERTRUD.html Cast includes Nina Pens Rode, Bendt Rothe, Ebbe Robe, Baard Owe and Axel Strobye. Note: Adapted from the play by Hjalmar Soderberg. In Danish with English subtitles.

results.title: Gateway to Asia
results.brief_description: With the distance between Canada and Russia, China and India cut by high-speed planes, new international links are being forged. In this Pacific world, British Columbia is a unit of growing importance. In a brief survey of the province, Gateway to Asia covers the people, natural resources, industries, and some of the social problems of British Columbia. Located on the Pacific Coast, it is the jumping-off place for planes bound for the Orient and Russia, and a vital link between the rest of Canada and her neighbors in the Far East. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Frances
results.creator_credit: Graeme Clifford, Jonathan Sanger, Brooksfilms and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: This is the story of Frances Farmer, whose troubled life made headlines in the 1930s. At 16, she was an award-winning high-school student in Seattle and at 23, a rising, provocative star of stage and screen, admired for her beauty and talent. At 27, a chain of relatively insignificant events led to her arrest and involuntary committal to a mental institution. Jessica Lange delivers a powerful, harrowing performance as the tormented Frances.

results.title: Fran
results.creator_credit: Glenda Hambly, David Rapsey, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Fran never knew her father, her mother was an alcoholic and she was a ward of the state at age five. Now in her thirties, Fran lives with her three children in suburbia. She is restless and has no intention of settling down. Fran has a way of attracting men and pick ups Jeff, a barman. Their relationship develops to a point where Fran is willing to follow him around the country. Unfortunately, Fran’s three children do not fit in with Jeff’s plans and Fran, blinded by love, dumps them with relatives for a “few days”. A “few days” becomes a few months and the children are placed in a welfare home. Fran’s life then becomes an endless battle with debt collectors and welfare officials, not only fighting for her children but fighting to be loved herself. Cast: Noni Hazlehurst, Alan Fletcher.

results.title: Four weddings and a funeral
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Duncan Kenworthy, Channel Four, PolyGram and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: This charming and quirky British romantic comedy stars Hugh Grant and Andy Macdowell as the two lovers who belong together…perhaps! An excellent cast, including an hilarious cameo by Rowan Atkinson as the tongued-tied vicar, “Four weddings & a funeral” is unashamedly sentimental, but at the same time reveals not only the “funny side” of relationships, but their fragility. As Hugh Grant catapaults from one emotional and social disaster to another, due to an excess of good manners and a very British tendency towards “keeping a stiff upper lip”, he eventually discovers that the course of true love diverges from his expected course down the altar.

results.title: Forgotten silver
results.creator_credit: Costa Botes, Peter Jackson, Sue Rodgers, New Zealand Film Commission, New Zealand On Air and Wingnut Films
results.brief_description: Made in part to celebrate 100 years of cinema, this startling documentary first aired on New Zealand television. When New Zealand film director Peter Jackson stumbles upon an old trunk of nitrate films in a backyard shed, it appears that he has uncovered a lost chapter in New Zealand film history. His discovery leads him to Colin McKenzie, an extraordinary New Zealand born film pioneer and avid inventor from the early 1900s. Jackson’s research reveals that McKenzie was responsible for developing many cinematic innovations including colour film, sync sound and tracking shots that had long been attributed to more famous motion picture pioneers. McKenzie also risked his life to make a silent biblical epic ‘Salome’ in remote bush on the West Coast of the South Island. As Jackson turns up more amazing facts about the McKenzie legacy, it gradually becomes apparent that his documentary is a meticulously staged hoax. The ‘mockumentary’ combines interviews with real people such as actor Sam Neill, film critic Leonard Maltin and Miramax Chairman Harvey Weinstein, with elaborately faked, utterly convincing silent film footage, still photographs and other archival material. Jackson and Botes’ film is a clever, slightly deranged parody of the earnest documentary tributes to the centenary of cinema that were being made at the time. When it first aired on New Zealand television it sparked a minor controversy, enraging viewers who had been duped into believing it was about a real historical subject.
